required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Research on Hidden Blood Loss in Laparoendoscopic Single-site Radical Hysterectomy With Pelvic Lymphadenectomy
clinical_study.official_title: A Research on Hidden Blood Loss in Laparoendoscopic Single-site Radical Hysterectomy With Pelvic Lymphadenectomy

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this cross-sectional study is to evaluate the hidden blood loss in patients who undergo laparoendoscopic single-site radical hysterectomy with pelvic lymphadenectomy and identity its risk factors.

detailed_description.textblock: The electronic medical data of 105 patients who undergo laparoendoscopic single-site radical hysterectomy in the following year to treat cervical cancer will be analyzed retrospectively in this study. The amount of hidden blood loss will be calculated according to Gross's formula. And multiple linear regression analysis will be employed to identify its risk factors.

primary_outcome.measure: the volume of hidden blood loss (mL)
primary_outcome.description: the specific volume of hidden blood loss in patients after the operation applying Gross's formula

secondary_outcome.measure: the risk factors of hidden blood loss
secondary_outcome.description: Performing multiple linear regression analysis with SPSS 17.0, we plan to identify the risk factors which can increase the volume of hidden blood loss from possible factors like hypertension, diabetes, etc.

secondary_outcome.measure: the volume of total blood loss (mL)
secondary_outcome.description: the volume of blood loss happened to patients through the whole perioperative period accoring to the method of Nadler

secondary_outcome.measure: the volume of visible blood loss (mL)
secondary_outcome.description: the volume of visible blood loss including the blood in the suction bottle and in weighed compresses during the operation and the drainage volume as the post-operative blood loss

arm_group.description: patients who undergo laparoendoscopic single-site radical hysterectomy with pelvic lymphadenectomy

study_pop.textblock: The planned sample size was based on data from a previous study, in which the standard deviation was 5. We assumed an one-tailed Î± error of 0.05 and a sampling error of 1.0. we propose to enroll 105 participants and allow for a dropout rate of 10% for an effective sample size of 100.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
